title: I don't understand doing the EXACT SAME Twitch nerf, and buff every year at the exact same time
body:
you literally change his passive from 2/3/4/5/6 to 1/2/3/4/5 at the end of every season, and then change it back at the beginning of the next season alternating every other year

what the fuck, just change something, this is so stupid, the difference isn't that big, but why is this something you do, do you fire developers so quickly that no one remembers?

replies.body: Maybe they are happy with how twitch plays, so they don't want to change him mechanically, and this is their go to change when his winrate is too high or low?

sometimes i feel like the balance of this game being flawed is all a giant distraction / illusion to keep people into the game so here and there they tweak the numbers purposely knowing ahead of time what will go outta hand and sit back and eat popcorn.

Like in reality they have the perfect the ratios and tweaks to have everything perfectly balanced but they just keep everything recycling. Just a theory though ill keep an eye open in the coming years with this game.

> [{quoted}](name=Yeezy Taught you,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=3sjtRkFM,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2016-12-07T12:18:21.988+0000)
>
> Like in reality they have the perfect the ratios and tweaks to have everything perfectly balanced but they just keep everything recycling.

{{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}   https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e31OSVZF77w

Yeah this video makes sense, but we definitely don't have perfect imbalance. Some champions are broken beyond belief and can be picked into and against almost any comp and others are only useful in some specific situations and even then you need to play it perfectly or you just get dumpstered by the other guy anyway.

Ive always felt this never really applies to league. At least you never get more than one cycle in a meta. Mostly bc people just kinda pick whatever they want most of the time, so even if you pick up a champ to deal with the meta, there's no sense picking up something to deal with THAT champ because so few people are using it even though it counters the meta champ.

Once in a while we get a true rock-paper-scissors homeostasis but only when nothing really changes for a couple months so people figure out the meta, and even then only rarely.

Its also just part of us only getting to pick one champ. Might be different in 5s idk, but this is way different from pokemon where one or two guys are often a revolving door of counters to things in the meta that are a threat to your core team.

>
> 
> 
> Once in a while we get a true rock-paper-scissors homeostasis but only when nothing really changes for a couple months so people figure out the meta, and even then only rarely.

The most recent true rock/paper/scissors I remember is season 3 top lane, and maybe mid lane at the time.  Jax/Shen/Renek and Ori/Gragas/Kass.  Mostly mid was just Ori/Gragas though since Kass was permabanned.

Yeah there isn't any sense in picking up something to deal with those champs because there are usually some blatantly overpowered picks which only get touched very lightly on each patch, meaning you can learn a champ and ride it in its broken state for months or even entire seasons, without needing to resort to 'counters' or anything because your champ just outstats whatever else.
Game state changes. So he has to be adapted to that change. They know this change will fix him for this current game state without ruining his gameplay.

This is the lever they use to control how strong Twitch's early game is. Twitch too weak early game? Buff is early poison damage to 2 per stack. Twitch early game too strong? Nerf early poison damage to 1 per stack.
Actually, the difference has some merit. That bonus 2 true damage lets him instakill {{champion:90}} voidlings, I don't know about other pets though.

As much as I hate the twitch passive nerf (really 1 true damage per stack?), it really does make sense for them to keep doing that nerf if it works.

We usually complain about Riot being unwilling to undo nerfs, Twitch represents one of the few occasions where they have.  I have faith they'll buff the passive back when he falls out of the meta and begins underperforming.
Can everyone just shut up about Twitch please, that would be great.
vayne always get buffs near the end of seasons and become op every single time until january pacth
He's sitting at ~55-56% winrate, and received no nerf, as well as having ~20% pickrate. Makes sense rito makes sense.
